The Battle of Waterloo, fought on June 18, 1815, marked the final defeat of Napoleon Bonaparte. This battle took place near Waterloo in present-day Belgium and resulted in the end of the Napoleonic era of European history. Following this loss, Napoleon was exiled to the remote island of Saint Helena in the South Atlantic where he died in 1821.

Where and when was the Battle of Waterloo fought, and what was its significance in European history?

ENDINSTRUCTION

The Battle of Waterloo was fought on June 18, 1815, near Waterloo in present-day Belgium. It was a significant event in European history as it marked the final defeat of Napoleon Bonaparte, leading to the end of his reign and the conclusion of the Napoleonic era. After this battle, Napoleon was exiled to Saint Helena in the South Atlantic, where he died in 1821.
